MN Notes: MN SNAP BBCE eliminates asset test; 200% FPL gross income threshold
Asset values not required for MN SNAP under BBCE
Asset verification not required for MN SNAP under BBCE
MN SNAP: not applicable under BBCE. MA Non-MAGI: $3,000 individual / $6,000 couple (MN adopted higher limits effective 2024).
MN SNAP: always true under BBCE; no resource test
MN SNAP uses 200% FPL gross income threshold under BBCE versus federal 130% gross / 100% net
MN SNAP: 200% FPL gross income test only under BBCE; no net income test
BBCE removes categorical ineligibility for lottery/gambling winnings in MN SNAP
Follows substantialLotteryWinnings removal under BBCE
County-specific ABAWD time-limit waivers available in qualifying areas; MN has historically obtained statewide or partial waivers

MN Policy/Statute: Minn. Stat. § 256B.06; Minn. Stat. § 256L.04; Minn. Stat. § 256D.38
MN Notes: MinnesotaCare covers lawfully present non-citizens. MA covers pregnant women regardless of immigration status. MSA/GA require lawful presence.

MN Policy/Statute: Minn. Stat. § 256B.055; Minn. Stat. § 256B.057; Minn. Stat. § 256L.04
MN Notes: MA (MAGI): 138% FPL adults, 275% FPL children, 278% FPL pregnant women. MinnesotaCare: adults and children to 200% FPL (broader than CHIP — covers adults). SSI auto-enrollment (1634 state).
MN is a 1634 state: SSI recipients receive automatic Medical Assistance enrollment

MN uses federal 60-month look-back for asset transfers (did NOT shorten like CA). Minnesota Medical Assistance Estate Recovery (MERP) is among the most aggressive in the nation per Minn. Stat. § 256B.15.
Medical Assistance for Employed Persons with Disabilities (MA-EPD): working disabled buy-in program up to 250% FPL
Must demonstrate current employment for MA-EPD eligibility
TEFRA option: children with disabilities eligible for Medical Assistance regardless of parental income; family pays a parental fee based on income

60-month federal lifetime limit applies. MFIP uniquely combines cash assistance + food assistance (SNAP-equivalent) in a single grant. People on MFIP do not receive separate SNAP. DWP provides 4-month diversion before MFIP entry.
MFIP good cause exemption includes domestic violence per Family Violence Option
Diversionary Work Program (DWP): 4-month employment-focused diversion program before MFIP entry; participants receive MFIP-level benefits while completing work activities
MFIP food portion amount (the SNAP-equivalent component of the combined MFIP grant). MFIP uniquely bundles cash + food; this field tracks the food portion separately for federal reporting.
EAP uses 50% state median income as income threshold; year-round operation (not seasonal); includes crisis assistance component for energy emergencies
Heat/eat: minimal EAP benefit confers SNAP Standard Utility Allowance (SUA) eligibility. Administered by community action agencies and tribal nations.
EAP crisis component: emergency assistance for imminent disconnection or fuel shortage; available year-round separate from primary EAP benefit
Minnesota Supplemental Aid amount; includes housing assistance supplement and special diet supplement. MN is a 1634 state — SSA administers federal SSI but MSA is state-administered by counties.
SSI-eligible individuals receive state supplement; housing assistance supplement and special diet supplement available. County-administered.
Last-resort cash for single adults without children who are not eligible for MFIP or SSI; $203/month maximum; county-administered.
Short-term crisis assistance for families with children facing housing loss or utility disconnection; county-administered; 30-day maximum per episode.

MN Policy/Statute: Minn. Stat. § 256D.35; Minn. Stat. § 256D.01; Minn. Stat. § 256J.48
MN Notes: Required for all state-only programs; MSA requires SSI eligibility (age or disability)

MN Policy/Statute: Minn. Stat. § 256D.35; Minn. Stat. § 256D.01; Minn. Stat. § 256J.48
MN Notes: Required for all state-only programs
Must meet SSI disability criteria for MSA eligibility

MN Policy/Statute: Minn. Stat. § 256D.35; Minn. Stat. § 256D.01; Minn. Stat. § 256J.48
MN Notes: Income type required for all state-only programs

MN Policy/Statute: Minn. Stat. § 256D.35; Minn. Stat. § 256D.01; Minn. Stat. § 256J.48
MN Notes: Income verification required for all state-only programs
Minnesota 87 counties each administer benefits; county code identifies administering office. Dual system: MAXIS (cash/food programs) and METS (health care programs).
MAXIS/METS case tracking number. MN uses dual eligibility systems: MAXIS for cash and food programs and METS for health care programs.
Verification of Minnesota residency required for all state-administered programs
MAXIS eligibility system client identifier; used across cash and food programs
Determines Medical Assistance benefit set and funding source; categories include MA-MAGI, MA-LTC, MA-EPD, TEFRA, MinnesotaCare
Added somali|hmong|karen|oromo for Minnesota refugee and immigrant communities per Minnesota language access requirements
